required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Use of Bupivacaine and Ropivacaine for Sciatic Nerve Block
clinical_study.official_title: A Dose Response Study for Duration of Analgesia Using Bupivacaine and Ropivacaine for Infragluteal Parabiceps Sciatic Block

brief_summary.textblock: The duration of motor block for infragluteal parabiceps sciatic nerve block following total knee replacement may vary between 12-36 hrs depending on the amount of local anesthetic given.

primary_outcome.measure: Duration of Motor and Sensory Block of the Sciatic With 0.5% Bupivacaine and Ropivacaine After Ultrasound-guided Nerve-stimulator-Assisted Needle Positioning Beneath the CIEL
primary_outcome.description: Subject reported and investigator measured motor and sensory blockade of the sciatic nerve with less than 10ml of 0.5% bupivacaine and ropivacaine after ultrasound-guided nerve-stimulator-assisted needle positioning beneath the common investing external layer (CIEL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Cumulative Probabilities for Needle Positioning Above and Below CIEL.
secondary_outcome.description: The cumulative probability distributions for the minimal current to evoke a motor response with the needle tip positioned external (above) to the common investing extraneural layer (CIEL) and the cumulative probability distribution for the needle tip postioned internal (below) to the CIEL were sought. The difference in the mean minimum threshold current (mA) for the external (above) and internal (below) CIEL positioning were calculated.

clinical_study.condition: The Duration of Motor Block May Vary Between 12-36 Hrs

arm_group.description: Varying does to determine duration of analgesia following a sciatic nerve block
Varying does to determine duration of analgesia following a sciatic nerve block

intervention.description: Varying doses to determine the duration of analgesia
Varying doses to determine the duration of analgesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients (>18 years of age) who are undergoing elective total knee arthroplasty will be included in the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Exclusion criteria for the study are patient refusal to be included in the study, contraindications to regional anesthesia, history of allergy to amide local anesthetics, the presence of a progressive neurological deficit, the presence of coagulopathy or infection, or pregnancy

overall_official.affiliation: Northwestern University Feinberg School of Medicine

facility.name: Northwestern University, Feingberg School of Medicine

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor in Anesthesiology and Orthopaedic Surgery

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects undergoing primary tricompartmental total knee replacement at Northwestern Memorial Hospital were asked to participate. 174 patients were approached. 142 subjects were recruited to participate.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Exclusion criteria: subject refusal to be included in the study, contraindications to regional anesthesia, inability to elicit an evoked motor response less than or equal to 1 mA, history of allergy to amide local anesthetics, presence of a progressive neurological deficit, opioid tolerant subjects, presence of coagulopathy, infection, or pregnancy

outcome.title: Cumulative Probabilities for Needle Positioning Above and Below CIEL.
outcome.description: The cumulative probability distributions for the minimal current to evoke a motor response with the needle tip positioned external (above) to the common investing extraneural layer (CIEL) and the cumulative probability distribution for the needle tip postioned internal (below) to the CIEL were sought. The difference in the mean minimum threshold current (mA) for the external (above) and internal (below) CIEL positioning were calculated.

group.title: Above CIEL
group.description: The mean threshold current required to elicit a motor response above the common investing extraneural layer (CIEL).

group.title: Below CIEL
group.description: The mean threshold current required to elicit a motor response below the common investing extraneural layer (CIEL).

measure.title: Cumulative Probabilities for Needle Positioning Above and Below CIEL.
measure.description: The cumulative probability distributions for the minimal current to evoke a motor response with the needle tip positioned external (above) to the common investing extraneural layer (CIEL) and the cumulative probability distribution for the needle tip postioned internal (below) to the CIEL were sought. The difference in the mean minimum threshold current (mA) for the external (above) and internal (below) CIEL positioning were calculated.

outcome.title: Duration of Motor and Sensory Block of the Sciatic With 0.5% Bupivacaine and Ropivacaine After Ultrasound-guided Nerve-stimulator–Assisted Needle Positioning Beneath the CIEL
outcome.description: Subject reported and investigator measured motor and sensory blockade of the sciatic nerve with less than 10ml of 0.5% bupivacaine and ropivacaine after ultrasound-guided nerve-stimulator–assisted needle positioning beneath the common investing external layer (CIEL).

group.title: Bupivacaine
group.description: Varying does to determine duration(motor/sensory)of analgesia following a sciatic nerve block Bupivacaine : 2.5ml and 5.0mL (less than 10ml) and greater than or equal to 10ml (10-30ml)

group.title: Ropivacaine
group.description: Varying does to determine duration(motor/sensory)of analgesia following a sciatic nerve block Ropivacaine : 2.5ml and 5.0mL (less than 10ml) and greater than or equal to 10ml (10-30ml)

measure.title: Duration of Motor and Sensory Block of the Sciatic With 0.5% Bupivacaine and Ropivacaine After Ultrasound-guided Nerve-stimulator–Assisted Needle Positioning Beneath the CIEL
measure.description: Subject reported and investigator measured motor and sensory blockade of the sciatic nerve with less than 10ml of 0.5% bupivacaine and ropivacaine after ultrasound-guided nerve-stimulator–assisted needle positioning beneath the common investing external layer (CIEL).

analysis.groups_desc: The sample selected for this study,70 per drug group (or 10 in each of the 7 groups), achieves 88% power to detect a minimal difference of 4 hours in duration at a significance level (α) of 0.05 and a standard deviation of 3 hours using Williams test. We chose a difference of 4 hours as this was the interval used for assessment in the postoperative period at night. We sought to detect a difference that was equal to 1 observation period difference.
analysis.p_value_desc: Post hoc comparison were made against the 30-mL volume group and corrected for 6 comparisons using the Wilcoxon rank sum test.

analysis.groups_desc: The sample selected for this study,70 per drug group (or 10 in each of the 7 groups), achieves 88% power to detect a minimal difference of 4 hours in duration at a significance level (α) of 0.05 and a standard deviation of 3 hours using Williams test. We chose a difference of 4 hours as this was the interval used for assessment in the postoperative period at night. We sought to detect a difference that was equal to 1 observation period difference.

The sample selected for this study,70 per drug group (or 10 in each of the 7 groups), achieves 88% power to detect a minimal difference of 4 hours in duration at a significance level (α) of 0.05 and a standard deviation of 3 hours using Williams test. We chose a difference of 4 hours as this was the interval used for assessment in the postoperative period at night. We sought to detect a difference that was equal to 1 observation period difference.

The sample selected for this study,70 per drug group (or 10 in each of the 7 groups), achieves 88% power to detect a minimal difference of 4 hours in duration at a significance level (α) of 0.05 and a standard deviation of 3 hours using Williams test. We chose a difference of 4 hours as this was the interval used for assessment in the postoperative period at night. We sought to detect a difference that was equal to 1 observation period difference.

reported_events.time_frame: Time frame for adverse event reporting was 12 months following surgery.

group.title: GROUP 1
group.description: Varying does to determine duration(motor/sensory)of analgesia following a sciatic nerve block Bupivacaine : 2.5ml and 5.0mL (less than 10ml) and greater than or equal to 10ml (10-30ml)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: We used 5-mL increments of local anesthetic w/epinephrine between 5-30 mL which may have prevented from identifying more precisely the volume at which onset/duration were similar.
